title: Inflation exceeded expected rate, so bank lost

content.prompt: When purchasing her house, Ms. Jones took out a 15-year mortgage loan from a local bank at a fixed interest rate of 7 percent. The rate of expected inflation at the time was 3 percent. If the actual rate of inflation was 4.5 percent, which of the following is true?

choices.label: The bank gained because the real rate of interest increased by 1.5%.
The bank gained because the real rate of interest became 3.5%.
The bank lost because the real rate of interest decreased by 1.5%.
Ms. Jones gained because the nominal rate of interest increased by 1.5%.
Ms. Jones lost because the nominal rate of interest became 3.5%.

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Interpret a specific economic outcome using quantitative data or calculations.
